trans-unit.source: Represents a <xref uid="langword_csharp_jsonSerialization" name="jsonSerialization" href=""></xref> configuration section in the <xref uid="langword_csharp_scripting" name="scripting" href=""></xref> element of the configuration file.
The ScriptingJsonSerializationSection class enables you to programmatically access and modify the `jsonSerialization` element of the configuration section for using AJAX functionality in ASP.NET.
Use this type to set serialization and deserialization configuration values for AJAX-enabled applications.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingJsonSerializationSection"></xref> class.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ConvertersCollection"></xref> object that contains a collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.Converter"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets the maximum length that is accepted by the <xref href="System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer"></xref> object for JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) strings.

The value of the MaxJsonLength property applies only to the internal <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer> instance that is used by the asynchronous communication layer to invoke Web services methods.
An integer that represents the maximum length for JSON strings.
Gets or sets the limit for constraining the number of object levels to process.

The RecursionLimit property refers to the maximum level of an object hierarchy that <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer> will process when deserializing a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) string or when serializing an object.

The value of RecursionLimit applies only to the internal <xref:System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer> instance that is used by the asynchronous communication layer to invoke Web services methods.
The property is being set to a value that is less than one.
